alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...EASTERN COSHOCTON...NORTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTHWESTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of West Lafayette, or 8 miles north of Coshocton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coshocton, Newcomerstown, West Lafayette, Baltic, Port Washington, Plainfield, Chili, Boden, Bakersville, and Kimbolton. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 52 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
